text: Coast to Kosciuszko (C2K) is a ultramarathon race run each December in New South Wales, Australia. The race commences at Twofold Bay (at sea level) and concludes at Charlotte Pass ( above sea level) after reaching the summit of Mount Kosciuszko (Australia's highest point at above sea level). ==Results== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Year !class="unsortable"|Male winner !Time !No. male runners !class="unsortable"|Female winner !Time !No. female runners !class="unsortable"|Course |- |2004 |Paul Every and Jan Herrmann | |align="center"|4 |— |— |align="center"|0 |Summit |- |2005 |Martin Fryer | |align="center"|7 |— |— |align="center"|0 |Summit |- |2006 |Wayne Gregory | |align="center"|8 |Carol La Plant | |align="center"|1 |Summit |- |2007 |Tim Cochrane | |align="center"|18 |Allison Lilley | |align="center"|2 |Summit |- |2008 |Tim Cochrane | |align="center"|20 |Kerrie Bremner | |align="center"|4 |Inclement weather* |- |2009 |Jo Blake | |align="center"|20 |Pam Muston | |align="center"|7 |Summit |- |2010 |Jo Blake | |align="center"|29 |Sharon Scholz | |align="center"|9 |Summit |- |2011 |Ewan Horsburgh | |align="center"|27 |Julia Fatton | |align="center"|9 |Summit |- |2012 |Ewan Horsburgh | |align="center"|26 |Bernadette Benson | |align="center"|8 |Summit |- |2013 |Ewan Horsburgh | |align="center"|22 |Jess Baker | |align="center"|9 |Summit |- |2014 |Andrew Tuckey | |align="center"|38 |Sabina Hamaty | |align="center"|9 |Summit |- |2015 |John Pearson | |align="center"|36 |Sabina Hamaty | |align="center"|12 |Summit |- |2016 |Kevin Muller | |align="center"|34 |Susan Keith | |align="center"|9 |Summit |- |2017 |Mick Thwaites | |align="center"|29 |Katy Anderson | |align="center"|11 |Summit |} * The 'inclement weather course' does not include the (approximately 18 km) return trip from Charlotte Pass to the summit. ==External links== * * *Course Map: http://www.gmap-pedometer.com/?r=1474779 Category:Ultramarathons Category:Athletics competitions in Australia Category:Recurring sporting events established in 2004 Category:2004 establishments in Australia
